Question_1.Context: The study focused on the radiolabeling of ACooP peptide with fluorine-18 for PET imaging applications. The prosthetic compound used for radiolabeling was 6-[18F]fluoronicotinic acid 4-nitrophenyl ester.
Question_1.Question: What was the radiochemical yield of the prosthetic compound 6-[18F]fluoronicotinic acid 4-nitrophenyl ester?
Question_1.Source: The decay-corrected radiochemical yield was 29.9% ± 2.3 (n = 4) and radiochemical purity was 96.6% ± 2.3.

Question_2.Context: The study involved the synthesis of FNA-S-ACooP and its comparison with FNA-N-ACooP.
Question_2.Question: How was the chemical structure of FNA-S-ACooP confirmed?
Question_2.Source: The chemical structure of FNA-S-ACooP was characterized by LC–MS and NMR analyzes.

Question_3.Context: The study involved the preparation of the prosthetic compound [18F]1 for radiolabeling.
Question_3.Question: How was [18F]1 synthesized?
Question_3.A: By passing through an anion-exchange cartridge
Question_3.Source: The cartridge was dried by passing through dry CH3CN followed by nitrogen gas. A mixture of precursor 4 and DABCO in CH3CN/tert-BuOH was pushed through the cartridge, and we indeed observed [18F]1 as the only radioactive product.

Question_4.Context: The study involved the stability assessment of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP.
Question_4.Question: What was the LogD7.4 value of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP?

Question_5.Context: The study involved in vitro tissue binding and autoradiography experiments.
Question_5.Question: How was the radioactivity binding in the tissue samples quantified?
Question_5.Source: The radioactivity binding in the tissue samples was quantified as photostimulated luminescence units per square millimeter (PSL/mm2) with the background radioactivity corrected.

Question_6.Context: The study involved the synthesis of the prosthetic compound 1 for radiolabeling.
Question_6.Question: What was the molar activity of [18F]1 at the end of synthesis?
Question_6.Source: The molar activity was 36.2 ± 22.0 MBq/nmol at the end of synthesis.

Question_7.Context: The study involved the stability assessment of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP.
Question_7.Question: How long was the stability of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP in the injectable formulation?
Question_7.Source: The stability of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP in the injectable formulation (PBS with 14 mM ascorbic acid) was at least 4 h at r.t.

Question_8.Context: The study involved the synthesis of FNA-S-ACooP and its comparison with FNA-N-ACooP.
Question_8.Question: How was the chemical structure of FNA-N-ACooP confirmed?
Question_8.Source: The chemical structure of FNA-N-ACooP was characterized by LC–MS and NMR analyzes.

Question_9.Context: The study involved the preparation of the prosthetic compound [18F]1 for radiolabeling.
Question_9.Question: What was the radiochemical purity of [18F]1?
Question_9.Source: The decay-corrected radiochemical yield was 29.9% ± 2.3 (n = 4) and radiochemical purity was 96.6% ± 2.3.

Question_10.Context: The study involved the stability assessment of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP.
Question_10.Question: What was the LogD7.4 value of [18F]FNA-S-ACooP?
